entries.title: How about some tmux
entries.body: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory - edit this post and re-build (or run with the -w switch) to see your changes! To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention: YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext. Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets: def print_hi ( name ) puts "Hi, #{ name } " end print_hi ( 'Tom' ) #=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT. Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo .

entries.title: We are the healthy hackers
entries.body: This is the short summary. It should appear in the posts listing on the index page. It can be long and wrap a bit. Maybe a bit more though cause that didn’t wrap. This & that. Workout of the week 3 rounds, as fast as possible, of: 15 push-ups 15 dips 1 mile run Tip of the week Do things well.

entries.title: Why I Use Vim
entries.body: This week I talk about why I choose to use Vim for all my text editing. Workout of the week This workout is awesome because you can do it anywhere. All you need is a floor. I’m pretty sure I do this at least once every time I travel. This is a 10 rep pyramid . Do each exercise 1 time, then 2 times, then 3 times, etc. Work up to 10 reps for each exercise, then go back down the pyramid with 9 reps, 8 reps, 7 reps, etc. You will finish the workout with a total of 100 reps for each exercise. Push-up Shoulder press If this seems like a bit too much right now, scale down the workout by choosing a smaller pyramid. You might surprise yourself. Take breaks as necessary, but go as fast as possible. @chrishunt: 7 minutes, 30 seconds
